title: Ashton's memorial :An history of the strange adventures, and signal deliverances, of Mr. Philip Ashton, who, after he had made his escape from the pirates, liv'd alone on a desolate island for about sixteen months, &c. : With a short account of Mr. Nicholas Merritt, who was taken at the same time. : To which is added a sermon on Dan. 3. 17.
imprint: Boston: Printed for Samuel Gerrish, at his shop in Corn-Hill
note: Possibly see Smith 1990, 'Strange Adventures and Signal Deliverances': Narrative Masks in John Barnard's Ashton's Memorial in New England Quarterly vol 63(1): 60-79 [https://hollis.harvard.edu/permalink/f/1mdq5o5/TN_cdi_proquest_journals_215294310]
